result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamison Alloway was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jamison Alloway is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jamison Alloway was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No consumption or possession of alcohol & no entering upon the premises of any bars or taverns.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA or similar meeting per week.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jamison Alloway

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jamison Alloway in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:38 PM. State - resolved - have complied with victim notification requirements - defendant would plead to count #2 as alleged, #1 - DRI, withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions. Alloway and Lynch agree. Court dismisses count #1. Alloway pleads G to count #2 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Lynch makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Alloway makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time emploment, costs (including DNA surcharge) - paid thru probation, submit DNA sample with expunction information, attend one AA/NA or similar treatment program once a week, 100 hours of community service, right to appeal. adjourned.

Defendant Jamison Alloway in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:09 PM. Lynch - not resolved and stated that they needed more time. State agrees. Lynch - plead to count #2 and dismiss count #1 with 1 year probation and no jail. Alloway agrees. Court goes over Frye with the defendant. Court continues bond, sets for JT.  Jury trial scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jamison Alloway in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:11 AM. Lynch has complaint, waives reading, enters NG pleas. Lynch would like bond amended to signature bond. State - no objections. Court - bond - modifies bond to $1000.00 signature with conditions of no consumption of alcohol, signs the no contact provision so that is lifted.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with victim, Carla Cobin.
